turn.text: --What is the incidence of re-return under the Hague Convention?

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: --There no cases because we don't run into this problem, quite frankly.
And -- and re-return is a catch phrase that was created here.

Bringing the child back would be a part of the court's inherent authority, part of the district court or the Court of Appeals' inherent authority, and it's the basis upon which Scotland has the child in the first place.

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: Isn't there a Spanish case?

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: I'm sorry?

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: Isn't there a Spanish case?

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: There is a Scottish custody case pending--

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: Not a Scottish; Spain, a case from Spain.

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: --A Spain -- a Spanish case, yes, Your Honor, there is.

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: Where the child was, in fact, returned when--

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: The child was sent to Poland based upon the trial court's decision in that case, and the child returned from Poland based upon the supreme court of Spain's decision in that case.
So there is a confusion between--

turn.speaker: ruth_bader_ginsburg
turn.label: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg
turn.text: Was the child returned, or was it just a decision that the appeal could not be avoided?
Was the child returned by Poland?

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: --Well, I don't know ultimately if the child was returned from Poland, so much as the supreme court--

turn.speaker: ruth_bader_ginsburg
turn.label: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg
turn.text: That's -- see, that's the whole problem is that you -- you're going to have rival decrees of two countries, which is what -- exactly what the convention was meant to avoid.

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: --Except that we never have.
I mean, this is a fairly young convention, we haven't had it that long, but we never have had that problem before.
It's been easy enough -- Ohlander v. Larson out of the Tenth Circuit is a great case to look at for where the United States has been very giving in sending children back.
We have not had this problem before.

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: --Counsel, there is an amici brief here that says that the Scottish courts will not pay attention to the habitual residence of a child at the time of the removal.
The amici brief that was filed with us yesterday, if I'm reading it correctly, suggests that the court believes that hasn't been settled in English law; is that correct?

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: That's my reading of it as well, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: sonia_sotomayor
turn.label: Justice Sonia Sotomayor
turn.text: That that -- so that proposition is not as settled as the amici suggests?

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: Correct.
I think they are waiting to see what -- what we want to do.
So you've got Villamonte v. Marquez, where the issue there is it's not moot because it's possible an extradited person could one day voluntarily return, so it's not moot.
But in this case, there is nothing preventing the mother, who filed the case before the district court and is still a party to the case, from voluntarily returning.
That enough is -- is enough to survive this--

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: Well, that sounds awfully speculative and conjectural.
That doesn't sound -- whether you're analyzing it under standing in the first instance or mootness later, that doesn't sound to be the sort of concrete injury that's required.

turn.speaker: michael_e_manely
turn.label: Mr. Michael E. Manely
turn.text: --The concrete injury has to do with the habitual residence determination in the district court, which switches if the appellate court reverses and grants habitual residence here and orders the child be brought back.
That is the concrete interest.

turn.speaker: john_g_roberts_jr
turn.label: Chief Justice John G. Roberts, Jr.
turn.text: Thank you, counsel.
The case is submitted.
